sen.j: 大和棟（やまとむねむね）又は高塀造（たかへいづくり）は日本の民家建築の1つである。
sen.e: Yamatomune, or Takaheizukuri, is a style of architecture of Japanese private houses.
Yamatomune, or Takaheizukuri, is one of the architectural styles of Japanese private houses.
sen.cmt: style of architectureをarchitectural styleに致しました。
sen.e: Yamatomune, or Takaheizukuri, is one of the architectural styles of Japanese private houses.

sen.j: 奈良県の民家で見られる建築様式。
sen.e: Yamatomune is an architectural style seen in private houses in Nara Prefecture.
Yamatomune is an architectural style seen in private houses in Nara Prefecture.
Yamatomune is an architectural style seen in private houses in Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 切妻の草葺と屋根瓦が組み合わせられている。
sen.e: Yamatomune has a combination of a thatched and tiled roof on a gable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。日本語の切妻は屋根の形状のことを指しますが、gableは壁面を意味しますので、訳文のような表現にしてみました。
sen.e: Yamatomune has a combination of a thatched and tiled roof on a gable.
Yamatomune has a combination of a thatched and tiled roof on a gable.

sen.j: 洗練された切妻の白い漆喰壁と屋根の対象性が美しいのが特徴。
sen.e: It is characterized by the beautiful contrast between the white plaster wall of a sophisticated gable and the roof.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。日本語の切妻は屋根の形状のことを指しますが、gableは壁面を意味しますので、訳文のような表現にしてみました。「対象」は「対照」の誤りと考えて訳しました。
sen.e: It is characterized by the beautiful contrast between the white plaster wall of a sophisticated gable and the roof.
It is characterized by the beautiful contrast between the white plaster wall of a sophisticated gable and the roof.

sen.j: 棟の高い部分が主屋で低い部分が釜屋（くどや土間）で構成されている。
sen.e: The higher part of the building is the main living area and the lower part is made into a "kamaya" (also called "kudoyadoma", a kitchen or an area with an earthen floor and a cooking stove).
sen.cmt: （）内には釜屋、くどや土間の説明を入れ込みました。
sen.e: The omoya (main building) is under the high ridge of the roof, and "kamaya" (also called "kudoyadoma", a kitchen or an area with an earthen floor and a cooking stove) is under the lower ridge.
sen.cmt: より自然な表現となるように修正致しました。
sen.e: The omoya (main building) is under the high ridge of the roof, and "kamaya" (also called "kudoyadoma," a kitchen or an area with an earthen floor and a cooking stove) is under the lower ridge.
